definitions.example: You rinse and de-string the green beans; I'll take it from there.

definitions.definition: (location) In a place or location (stated, implied or otherwise indicated) at some distance from the speaker (compare here).
In that matter, relation, etc.; at that point, stage, etc., regarded as a distinct place.
definitions.example: He did not stop there, but continued his speech.

definitions.definition: (location) To or into that place; thither.
Where, there where, in which place.
In existence or in this world; see pronoun section below.
Used as an expletive subject of be in its sense of “exist”, with the semantic, usually indefinite subject being postponed or (occasionally) implied.
definitions.example: Is there an answer? [=Does an answer exist?]

definitions.definition: Used with other intransitive verbs of existence, in the same sense, or with other intransitive verbs, adding a sense of existence.
definitions.example: If x is a positive number, then there exists [=there is] a positive number y less than x.

definitions.definition: Used with other verbs, when raised.
definitions.example: I expected there to be a simpler solution. [=I expected that there would be a simpler solution.]

definitions.definition: (in combination with certain prepositions, no longer productive) That.
Used to replace an unknown name, principally in greetings and farewells
Used to offer encouragement or sympathy.
definitions.example: There, there. Everything is going to turn out all right.

definitions.definition: Used to express victory or completion.
